primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The American nation (Subject) must realize its divinely appointed purpose of establishing a society of mutuality and justice (Object) by following the mandate of the Great Commandment (Sender/Law) to ensure its survival and glory (Receiver).

tekstueel_bewijs: we have been given the mandate, to contract a society of mutuality and harmony
we may confidently look to some bright tomorrow

object.identificatie: A society of mutuality, harmony, and 'eternal life' for the nation.
tekstueel_bewijs: an open democracy with liberty and justice for all
to establish justice and then, to ensure domestic tranquility

zender.identificatie: The Creator / The Founding Fathers / The Law of Nature
tekstueel_bewijs: endowed by their Creator with certain unalienable rights
the original intent of this land
this land which God has given us all
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

helper.identificatie: The New Administration / The Founding Documents / Time
tekstueel_bewijs: new energy and vigor being turned loose affirmatively in the coming to incumbency of our new president
history and time and justice would erase those stains
helper.rol_van_god: God is the distant Sender/Validator, not the active Subject.
helper.rol_van_geest: Absent; replaced by 'new energy' of political change.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponents are historical stains and social inequalities that can be 'erased' by time and human adherence to the 'original intent'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The individual (Subject) must learn to love themselves correctly (Object) by understanding their creaturehood before God (Helper).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Individual Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Individual self-understanding is presented as a prerequisite for the national project of loving the neighbor.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Creator → Liberty/Justice → The American People

voorbeelden_god_subject: this land which God has given us all
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we have been given the mandate
this do, and thou shalt live

voorbeelden: Thou shalt love the Lord thy God
This do, and thou shalt live
it becomes necessary for one people
I would that I could tell them
how do we know how... to deal with 'as thyself'?
the only place where we can find this out
we are able to understand the splendor

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily weighted toward obligation (Devoir). It assumes that if the 'original intent' is known (Savoir) and the mandate is accepted (Devoir), the nation has the inherent power (Pouvoir) to save itself.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Slavery) through ~S2 (Shortcomings/Actualities) toward S1 (The Bright Tomorrow).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through human action ('This do') and the passage of time, rather than a divine intervention.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 (Slavery) is treated as a historical 'stain' to be erased rather than a radical ontological evil requiring a Savior.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon uses the 'Good Samaritan' and the 'Great Commandment' as a blueprint for national civic improvement. The engine of the sermon is human performance ('This do') to achieve a political/social object.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: God is the one who 'attends' the country's purpose or 'gives' the land for our use.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: this country would not have come into existence without the purposes of Almighty God

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Founding Fathers and the 'Good Samaritan' are used as models of intent and action for the current nation to emulate.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: The Lawyer (as a seeker of purpose)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: A theocentric reading would focus on Christ as the Good Samaritan who rescues the helpless traveler (humanity) when they could not 'do' anything to live.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Inspiration followed by the weight of a moral mandate.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Pelagianism; the belief that human will can fulfill the law to secure life.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically coherent but theologically confused, blending the 'Kingdom of God' with the 'American Proposition'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The 'original intent' and the 'Great Commandment' serve as the ideal we must return to.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'new energy' of the presidency replaces the empowerment of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a 'stain' or 'disparity' that can be removed by justice and time.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a civic exhortation where the Nation is the Subject and the Law is the Sender. God is relegated to a spectator or a historical initiator.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The American people are the subjects of the verbs of salvation/renewal.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God/Christ the Subject who establishes justice where man failed.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We are here to establish justice,' use 'God is here to establish His justice among us.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Doer' of the Law.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the wounded man on the road (Receiver).
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Re-read the parable with Christ as the Samaritan and the hearer as the one who cannot 'do' anything to inherit life.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how God gives the power to love, rather than just the command to love.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Present sin as a 'deadly power' that only a Savior can overcome.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a heavy opponent, grace becomes unnecessary advice.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The secondary program (ethics) has swallowed the primary program (soteriology).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Proclaim what God has done (Program 1) before asking what we should do (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is a powerful piece of civil religion, but structurally it replaces the Gospel of Grace with a Gospel of National Effort.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this is a masterpiece of 'American Jeremiah' style; semiotically, it is anthropocentric.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would note the lawyer's self-justification; the sermon adopts the lawyer's 'What must I do?' framework as its own.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the 'God' language, the 'Subject' slot is occupied by the Nation, making it a secular narrative in religious dress.

appendices.notities: The sermon was delivered at an inaugural prayer service, which explains the high degree of civil religion and focus on the 'American Proposition'.
